alert.note: Alert for Accomack (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 6:55AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN SOMERSET AND NORTHERN ACCOMACK COUNTIES THROUGH 730 AM EDT... At 655 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Lawsonia to near Parksley. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lawsonia around 700 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Hallwood, Byrdtown, Smith Island, Hopewell, Saxis, Temperanceville, Shelltown, Sanford, Oak Hall, and Clam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
